The, also known as the Taishō era, was a after "Meiji" and before "Shōwa." This period started on July 30, 1912 and ended on December 25, 1926. During this time, the emperor was.
The "nengō" "Taishō" means "Great Justice" or "Great Righteousness".
Events of the Taishō period.
The years in which Taishō was the Japanese monarch comprise this period or era.
